title: (x) Tech sans - custom type by Mevis and van Deursen w/ Radim Pesko for Museum Boijmans
content:
Anyone who knows the ID of this font?  
Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [test\_font.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103010323/http:/typophile.com/files/test_font.jpg) | 45.98 KB |

 [‹ (x) "A marriage" narrow sans w/ E like inverted 3 - Tarzana Narrow {Marcelo}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103010323/http:/typophile.com/node/39652 "Go to previous forum topic") [Design Council Logo - does anyone know what typeface it is? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103010323/http:/typophile.com/node/39615 "Go to next forum topic")
author: lahadas

comments.content: It looks like handmade with ruler or some other utility.

reminiscent of [Miso](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103010323/http:/www.typophile.com/node/17159) or Gravur Condensed  
from [Lineto](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103010323/http:/www.lineto.com/)
I think that is custom type designed for Museum Boijmans in Rotterdam by Mevis and van Deursen with Radim Pesko

@james: it’s not the Boijmans van Beuningen type.

I agree with visuatek that it’s probably a stencil.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103010323im_/http:/typophile.com/files/2061703045_153c25532d_o_4340.jpg)

Here’s an example of it in use at Boijmans.

haha, it actually IS the BvB-font! Somehow I remembered it as being - less all over the place.  
Anyway, if you look closely at the first image you provided, the sample text is on the second sign from the right!

thank you guys. you are amazing.  
The identity for the Boijmans van Beuningen Museum is actually very impressing. Nice work, nice™ font.  
ciao!
